workflow.name: Bidirectional ticket sync between Freshdesk and Linear with error logging
workflow.description:
## How it works

This workflow synchronizes support tickets in Freshdesk with issues in Linear, enabling smooth collaboration between support and development teams. It triggers on new or updated Freshdesk tickets, maps fields to Linear‚Äôs format, and creates linked issues through Linear‚Äôs API. Reverse synchronization is also supported, so changes in Linear update the corresponding Freshdesk tickets. Comprehensive logging ensures success and error events are always tracked.

## Step-by-step

**1. Trigger the workflow**  
- **New Ticket Webhook** ‚Äì Captures new Freshdesk tickets for issue creation.  
- **Update Ticket Webhook** ‚Äì Detects changes in existing tickets.  
- **Linear Issue Updated Webhook** ‚Äì Listens for updates from Linear.  

**2. Transform and map data**  
- **Map Freshdesk Fields to Linear** ‚Äì Converts priority, status, title, and description for Linear.  
- **Map Linear to Freshdesk Fields** ‚Äì Converts Linear state, priority, and extracts ticket ID for Freshdesk updates.  

**3. Perform API operations**  
- **Create Linear Issue** ‚Äì Sends GraphQL mutation to Linear API.  
- **Check Linear Creation Success** ‚Äì Validates issue creation before linking.  
- **Link Freshdesk with Linear ID** ‚Äì Updates Freshdesk with Linear reference.  
- **Update Freshdesk Ticket** ‚Äì Pushes Linear updates back to Freshdesk.  

**4. Manage logging and errors**  
- **Log Linear Creation Success** ‚Äì Records successful ticket-to-issue sync.  
- **Log Linear Creation Error** ‚Äì Captures and logs issue creation failures.  
- **Log Freshdesk Update Success** ‚Äì Confirms successful reverse sync.  
- **Log Missing Ticket ID Error** ‚Äì Handles missing ticket reference errors.  

## Why use this?

- Keep support and development teams aligned with real-time updates.  
- Eliminate manual ticket-to-issue handoffs, saving time and reducing errors.  
- Maintain full visibility with detailed success and error logs.  
- Enable bidirectional sync between Freshdesk and Linear for true collaboration.  
- Improve response times by ensuring both teams always work on the latest data.

parameters.content:
## üé£ Webhook Triggers & Data Entry

*Entry points that initiate the synchronization workflow:*

‚Ä¢ **New Ticket Webhook** - Captures newly created Freshdesk tickets via POST endpoint
‚Ä¢ **Update Ticket Webhook** - Handles modifications to existing Freshdesk tickets

*These webhooks serve as the primary triggers that start the Freshdesk-YOUR_OPENAI_KEY_HERE-Linear synchronization process, automatically routing incoming ticket data to the field mapping stage.*

## üìÑ Data Transformation & Field Mapping

*Critical Data Processing (Field Mapping):
‚Ä¢ Freshdesk ‚Üí Linear ‚Äî Converts ticket data into Linear-ready format, including priority (Low/Medium/High/Urgent ‚Üî 4/3/2/1) and status (Open/Pending/Resolved/Closed ‚Üî todo/in_progress/done/canceled), with proper title/description formatting.*

## üéØ API Operations & External Integration

*Direct communication with external platforms:*

‚Ä¢ **Create Linear Issue** - Makes GraphQL mutation calls to Linear API for issue creation
‚Ä¢ **Check Linear Creation Success** - Validates successful API response before proceeding
‚Ä¢ **Link Freshdesk with Linear ID** - Updates Freshdesk ticket with Linear issue reference for bidirectional linking

*These nodes handle the core integration logic, ensuring reliable data exchange between platforms with proper authentication and error validation.*

## üìä Logging & Operation Management

*Comprehensive monitoring and audit trail system:*

‚Ä¢ **Log Linear Creation Success** - Records successful operations with timestamps and IDs
‚Ä¢ **Log Linear Creation Error** - Captures detailed failure information for debugging

*This logging system provides complete visibility into sync operations, enabling easy troubleshooting and maintaining audit trails for all ticket-to-issue creation processes.*

## üé£ Webhook Trigger & Data Entry

*Entry point for Linear-to-Freshdesk synchronization:*

‚Ä¢ **Linear Webhook - Issue Updated** - Receives webhook notifications when Linear issues are modified

*This webhook serves as the reverse sync trigger, capturing Linear issue updates and initiating the process to sync changes back to corresponding Freshdesk tickets.*

## üìä Logging & Error Management

*Comprehensive monitoring for reverse sync operations:*

‚Ä¢ **Log Freshdesk Update Success** - Records successful ticket updates with timestamps and IDs
‚Ä¢ **Log Missing Ticket ID Error** - Captures cases where Linear issues lack Freshdesk ticket references

*This logging system provides visibility into reverse sync operations, enabling troubleshooting of failed updates and maintaining audit trails for Linear-to-Freshdesk synchronization.*

nodes.name: üîç Check if Freshdesk Ticket ID Exists

parameters.content:
## üéØ API Operations & Validation

*External communication and data integrity checks:*

‚Ä¢ **Check if Freshdesk Ticket ID Exists** - Validates that Linear issue contains valid Freshdesk ticket reference
‚Ä¢ **Update Freshdesk Ticket** - Makes REST API calls to Freshdesk to update ticket with synced data

*These nodes ensure reliable reverse sync by validating ticket linkage before attempting updates and handling the actual API communication with Freshdesk.*

## üìÑ Data Transformation & Field Mapping

*Critical data processing back to Freshdesk:
‚Ä¢ Map Linear ‚Üí Freshdesk Fields ‚Äî Converts Linear issue data into Freshdesk format, handling state mapping (todo/backlog‚ÜíOpen, in_progress‚ÜíPending, done‚ÜíResolved, canceled‚ÜíClosed), priority conversion (1‚Äî4 ‚Üî 4‚Äî1), and restoring the original Freshdesk ticket ID from the description.*

main.node: üîç Check if Freshdesk Ticket ID Exists

data.details: The Function node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow. Unlike the Function Item node, this node does not operate on incoming node data per-item. Instead, you must iterate over multiple items of incoming data yourself. This can be useful if you're performing data transformation where you want to manipulate the number of items being outputted by the node (i.e. 1 item is inputted in with nested object, 10 items are outputted without any nested objects)

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
